N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 646.3 - Advances under a trust mortgage

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 259
(a) Whenever a further amount is to be advanced or to become secured by a trust
mortgage, the applicable mortgage recording taxes as described in Part 642 of
this Title are imposed based on such amount. (b) The certification of any bond or bonds by
the trust mortgagee are deemed an advance under article 11 of the Tax

Law. (c) The mortgage recording
taxes imposed on the further amounts to be advanced or to become secured by a
trust mortgage must be paid at or before the time the advance is
made. (d) The mortgagor must, at
the time of paying the appropriate mortgage recording taxes on a further
advance, file in the office of the recording officer of the county where the
mortgage is first recorded and with the commissioner, a verified statement of
the amount to be so advanced or to become secured. The verified statement must
be made by the secretary, treasurer or other proper officer of the
mortgagor. (e) The recording
officer to whom the taxes are paid shall endorse the receipt of such tax
payment upon the mortgage and note the payment on the margin of the record in
the book where the mortgage is recorded or note the payment in some other
manner which would provide a public record of such payment. Upon request the
recording officer must issue a duplicate receipt for the tax payment to the
party paying the tax. (f) If the
appropriate taxes are not duly paid on the further amounts to be advanced or to
become secured by a trust mortgage, the trust mortgagee shall not certify any
bonds or obligations evidencing such further amounts under the
mortgage. Notes
